oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The algebraic method in tree percolation
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Mohammadi, Fatemeh
Sáenz-de-Cabezón, Eduardo
Wynn, Henry P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Combinatorics
Mathematics - Commutative Algebra
Mathematics - Probability
Mathematics - Rings and Algebras
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We apply the methods of algebraic reliability to the study of percolation on trees. To a complete $k$-ary tree $T_{k,n}$ of depth $n$ we assign a monomial ideal $I_{k,n}$ on $\sum_{i=1}^n k^i$ variables and $k^n$ minimal monomial generators. We give explicit recursive formulae for the Betti numbers of $I_{k,n}$ and their Hilbert series, which allow us to study explicitly percolation on $T_{k,n}$. We study bounds on this percolation and study its asymptotical behavior with the mentioned commutative algebra techniques.
Comment: to appear in SIAM Journal on Discrete Mathematics
